property.name: isValid
property.shortdesc: Returns true if the object specifier resolves to valid objects.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent of the IndexOptions &#40;a Document or Application).

property.name: events
property.shortdesc: A collection of events.

property.name: eventListeners
property.shortdesc: A collection of event listeners.

property.name: title
property.shortdesc: The title of the generated index.

property.name: titleStyle
property.shortdesc: The paragraph style applied to the title of the generated index. Can also accept: String.

property.name: replaceExistingIndex
property.shortdesc: If true, replaces the content of the existing index. Note: Replaces only index content; does not update the index location or other index properties that may have been changed.

property.name: includeBookDocuments
property.shortdesc: If true, includes topics and page references from all the documents in a book.

property.name: includeHiddenEntries
property.shortdesc: If true, includes topics and page references on hidden layers.

property.name: indexFormat
property.shortdesc: The format for level 2 and lower index topics.

property.name: includeSectionHeadings
property.shortdesc: If true, displays the letters of the alphabet as index section headings.

property.name: includeEmptyIndexSections
property.shortdesc: If true, displays headings for sections with no index topics. Note: Valid only when include section headings is true.

property.name: level1Style
property.shortdesc: The paragraph style applied to level 1 index topics.

property.name: level2Style
property.shortdesc: The paragraph style applied to level 2 index topics.

property.name: level3Style
property.shortdesc: The paragraph style applied to level 3 index topics.

property.name: level4Style
property.shortdesc: The paragraph style applied to level 4 index topics.

property.name: sectionHeadingStyle
property.shortdesc: The paragraph style applied to index section headings. Note: Valid when include section headings is true.

property.name: pageNumberStyle
property.shortdesc: The character style applied to page numbers in the index.

property.name: crossReferenceStyle
property.shortdesc: The character style applied to cross references.

property.name: crossReferenceTopicStyle
property.shortdesc: The character style applied to cross reference topics.

property.name: followingTopicSeparator
property.shortdesc: The character&#40;s) inserted after each index topic.

property.name: betweenEntriesSeparator
property.shortdesc: The character&#40;s) inserted between index entries when runin-style index format is used for nested topics.

property.name: pageRangeSeparator
property.shortdesc: The character&#40;s) inserted between page numbers to indicate a page range.

property.name: betweenPageNumbersSeparator
property.shortdesc: The character&#40;s) inserted between separate page numbers, page numbers and page ranges, and series of page ranges.

property.name: beforeCrossReferenceSeparator
property.shortdesc: The character&#40;s) inserted at the start of cross references.

property.name: entryEndSeparator
property.shortdesc: The character&#40;s) inserted at the end of each index entry.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: A property that allows setting of several properties at the same time.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Generates a string which, if executed, will return the IndexOptions.

method.name: getElements
method.shortdesc: Resolves the object specifier, creating an array of object references.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The event handler. Can accept: File or JavaScript Function.

parameter.name: handler
parameter.shortdesc: The registered event handler. Can accept: File or JavaScript Function.
